title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Hello, 
When it got here the  first time  Trackpad was not working so we inyected voltage to u5805 , Got hot , after that , the mb stopped turning on. 

have this Right Now
- Green Light on
- PSU consumes 0.01A
- PP5V_S3= 0
- P5VS3_EN_L=3.42 , but P5VS3_ENTRIP=0
- 5V3V_REG_EN= 3.22 , but PP5VS5_LDO=0
- P5VP3V3_REG3=0

What could it be?  
Is it possible to turn it on without u5805

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Injected voltage on U5805 which pin and why???

Post diode mode to ground at 5V_S5.
If short (or low value), remove R5805, L5800 and check again.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Thanks for the welcoming. 
 
Injected in pin 1 to see if it strated to get hot. Which it did.   

5V_S5 is not in Short .  value reads 630 in diode mode.

3V3_S5/SUS = 0.36

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Do NOT inject voltage without reason for the future.

Post basic voltages for U7200; pins 16, 13, 3, 8, 17, 1, 6.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message: It was a Faulty U7200 . Thanks !!!  it Works now

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Update: It turns on but no Video nor USB activity :( . Tried another Bios too and no help.
Im getting theses values.

 L7510/20 = 1.12V

PLT_RESET_L=3.32V

CPU_MEM RESET_L=0.67V

 mem_reset_L = 1.5V

Is it possible that CPU is bad?

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
You must discard other options first.

When board really boots, VCORE should drop from 1.12V to 0.78V aprox.
Try one good DDR module at a time, each slot.
Be sure all resistors around U7400 are good, as traces too.
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
Finally, heat PCH and/or CPU with good flux; no more than 180-200 degrees, for 15-20s.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Hello friend, 

 The resistors near the u7400 are all good,

RAM slots are OK!
We also heat the PCH and CPU.

Nothing new happend

but Im not sure with the SPI values . 

R5120 - 3,20V
R5121 - 0V
R5122 - 0V
R5123 - 3,19V


R5125 - 3,32V
R5126 - 0V
R5127 - 0V
R5128 - 3,16V

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
You must check ohm value for the resistors and their traces continuity.
Should be good to test RAM slots with dedicated post card.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
all resistors are OK , But I was checking a good M.B and got

CPU_IMVP_FBA_R= 0.78 V ( TURNED ON , WORKING MACBOOK)
CPU_IMVP_FBA_R= 1.1V  ( NOT WORKING MB)

Is this anything?  We also got PPBUS_G3H=12,55v . I dont think this is anything to be concerd off. Im trying to find a Diagnostic Post Card , we did not have one.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
VCORE drops from 1.1V to 0.78V when board really boots.
This is a basic test, to confirm CPU is running.

Be sure to test with known good BIOS.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:

on pin 17 of u7300
DDRVTT_EN = 0V
Therefore PPVTT_S0_DDR_LDO = 0V

so i measured these signals
PLT_RESET_L = 0V
 
MEMVTT_EN = 0V
MEMVTT_EN_L = 5V

ISOLATE_CPU_MEM_L = 0V
PP5V_S3_MEMRESET = 5V
PM_SLP_S3_L = 3.3V

is it possible that the problem is in the PCH? what would you recommend?

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
"PLT_RESET_L=3.32V
------------------
PLT_RESET_L = 0V"
What happened?

VTT appears later, after power on sequence is finished.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power

Sorry, it may be my mistake the first time I measured PLT_RESET_L.

But now PLT_RESET_L = 0V

VCORE is still at 1.1V

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message: Check pin 4 of U2650/60.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power

CPUIMVP_PGOOD = 0V

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
Check R7402/03.
Be sure R2650 is good.

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
I checked u2650 and saw in the microscope that pins 2 and 3 were joined by little solder, I resold it and I have
pin 4 of U2650 / 60 = 3.32 V
pin 17 of u7300 = 3.32V
pin 3 of u7300 = 0.75V

VCORE is still at 1.1V

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message: Do you get PLT_RESET_L now?

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message: Possibly CPU issue...

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message:
testing on a good board PLT_RESET_L = 0V.

I shouldn't get it in s5 right?

title: 820_3115 b a1278 No power
message: NO, PLT_RESET_L only goes high once PCH "understand" that power on sequence is acomplished.
